audit.Config.description: AuditConfig contains the audit logging configuration

component.description: Component is the component name to use in audit events

event_types.description: EventTypes specifies which event types to audit. If empty, all events are audited.

exclude_event_types.description:
ExcludeEventTypes specifies which event types to exclude from auditing.
This takes precedence over EventTypes.

include_request_data.description: IncludeRequestData determines whether to include request data in audit logs

include_response_data.description: IncludeResponseData determines whether to include response data in audit logs

log_file.description: LogFile specifies the file path for audit logs. If empty, logs to stdout.

max_data_size.description: MaxDataSize limits the size of request/response data included in audit logs (in bytes)

allowPrivateIP.description: AllowPrivateIP allows JWKS/OIDC endpoints on private IP addresses

audience.description: Audience is the expected audience for the token

authTokenFile.description: AuthTokenFile is the path to file containing bearer token for authentication

cacertPath.description: CACertPath is the path to the CA certificate bundle for HTTPS requests

clientID.description: ClientID is the OIDC client ID

clientSecret.description: ClientSecret is the optional OIDC client secret for introspection

introspectionURL.description: IntrospectionURL is the optional introspection endpoint for validating tokens

issuer.description: Issuer is the OIDC issuer URL (e.g., https://accounts.google.com)

jwksurl.description: JWKSURL is the URL to fetch the JWKS from

resourceURL.description: ResourceURL is the explicit resource URL for OAuth discovery (RFC 9728)

authz.CedarConfig.description:
Cedar is the Cedar-specific configuration.
This is only used when Type is ConfigTypeCedarV1.

entities_json.description: EntitiesJSON is the JSON string representing Cedar entities

policies.description: Policies is a list of Cedar policy strings

version.description: Version is the version of the configuration format.

authz.ConfigType.description: Type is the type of authorization configuration.

client_type.description: ClientType is the type of MCP client

installed.description: Installed indicates whether the client is installed on the system

registered.description: Registered indicates whether the client is registered in the ToolHive configuration

created_at.description: CreatedAt is the timestamp when the workload was created.

group.description: Group is the name of the group this workload belongs to, if any.

labels.description: Labels are the container labels (excluding standard ToolHive labels)

name.description:
Name is the name of the workload.
It is used as a unique identifier.

package.description: Package specifies the Workload Package used to create this Workload.

port.description:
Port is the port on which the workload is exposed.
This is embedded in the URL.

status_context.description:
StatusContext provides additional context about the workload's status.
The exact meaning is determined by the status and the underlying runtime.

tool_type.description:
ToolType is the type of tool this workload represents.
For now, it will always be "mcp" - representing an MCP server.

tools.description: ToolsFilter is the filter on tools applied to the workload.

url.description: URL is the URL of the workload exposed by the ToolHive proxy.

ignore.Config.description: IgnoreConfig contains configuration for ignore processing

loadGlobal.description: Whether to load global ignore patterns

printOverlays.description: Whether to print resolved overlay paths for debugging

allow_host.description: AllowHost is a list of allowed hosts

allow_port.description: AllowPort is a list of allowed ports

insecure_allow_all.description: InsecureAllowAll allows all outbound network connections

permissions.Profile.description: PermissionProfile is the permission profile to use

name.description: Name is the name of the profile

read.description:
Read is a list of mount declarations that the container can read from
These can be in the following formats:
- A single path: The same path will be mounted from host to container
- host-path:container-path: Different paths for host and container
- resource-uri:container-path: Mount a resource identified by URI to a container path

write.description:
Write is a list of mount declarations that the container can write to
These follow the same format as Read mounts but with write permissions

default.description:
Default is the value to use if the environment variable is not explicitly provided
Only used for non-required variables

description.description: Description is a human-readable explanation of the variable's purpose

name.description: Name is the environment variable name (e.g., API_KEY)

required.description:
Required indicates whether this environment variable must be provided
If true and not provided via command line or secrets, the user will be prompted for a value

secret.description:
Secret indicates whether this environment variable contains sensitive information
If true, the value will be stored as a secret rather than as a plain environment variable

args.description:
Args are the default command-line arguments to pass to the MCP server container.
These arguments will be used only if no command-line arguments are provided by the user.
If the user provides arguments, they will override these defaults.

custom_metadata.description: CustomMetadata allows for additional user-defined metadata

description.description: Description is a human-readable description of the server's purpose and functionality

docker_tags.description: DockerTags lists the available Docker tags for this server image

env_vars.description: EnvVars defines environment variables that can be passed to the server

image.description: Image is the Docker image reference for the MCP server

name.description:
Name is the identifier for the MCP server, used when referencing the server in commands
If not provided, it will be auto-generated from the image name

repository_url.description: RepositoryURL is the URL to the source code repository for the server

status.description: The Status indicates whether the server is currently active or deprecated

tags.description: Tags are categorization labels for the server to aid in discovery and filtering

target_port.description: TargetPort is the port for the container to expose (only applicable to SSE and Streamable HTTP transports)

tier.description: Tier represents the tier classification level of the server, e.g., "official" or "community" driven

tools.description: Tools is a list of tool names provided by this MCP server

transport.description: Transport defines the communication protocol for the server (stdio, sse, or streamable-http)

registry.Metadata.description: Metadata contains additional information about the server such as popularity metrics

last_updated.description: LastUpdated is the timestamp when the server was last updated, in RFC3339 format

pulls.description: Pulls indicates how many times the server image has been downloaded

stars.description: Stars represents the popularity rating or number of stars for the server

registry.Provenance.description: Provenance contains verification and signing metadata

last_updated.description: LastUpdated is the timestamp when the registry was last updated, in RFC3339 format

servers.description: Servers is a map of server names to their corresponding server definitions

version.description: Version is the schema version of the registry

audit_config_path.description: AuditConfigPath is the path to the audit configuration file

authz_config_path.description: AuthzConfigPath is the path to the authorization configuration file

base_name.description: BaseName is the base name used for the container (without prefixes)

cmd_args.description: CmdArgs are the arguments to pass to the container

container_labels.description: ContainerLabels are the labels to apply to the container

container_name.description: ContainerName is the name of the container

debug.description: Debug indicates whether debug mode is enabled

env_vars.description: EnvVars are the parsed environment variables as key-value pairs

group.description: Group is the name of the group this workload belongs to, if any

host.description: Host is the host for the HTTP proxy

image.description: Image is the Docker image to run

isolate_network.description: IsolateNetwork indicates whether to isolate the network for the container

jwks_allow_private_ip.description: JWKSAllowPrivateIP allows JWKS/OIDC endpoints on private IP addresses

jwks_auth_token_file.description: JWKSAuthTokenFile is the path to file containing auth token for JWKS/OIDC requests

k8s_pod_template_patch.description:
K8sPodTemplatePatch is a JSON string to patch the Kubernetes pod template
Only applicable when using Kubernetes runtime

middleware_configs.description:
MiddlewareConfigs contains the list of middleware to apply to the transport
and the configuration for each middleware.

name.description: Name is the name of the MCP server

permission_profile_name_or_path.description: PermissionProfileNameOrPath is the name or path of the permission profile

port.description: Port is the port for the HTTP proxy to listen on (host port)

secrets.description:
Secrets are the secret parameters to pass to the container
Format: "<secret name>,target=<target environment variable>"

target_host.description: TargetHost is the host to forward traffic to (only applicable to SSE transport)

target_port.description: TargetPort is the port for the container to expose (only applicable to SSE transport)

thv_ca_bundle.description: ThvCABundle is the path to the CA certificate bundle for ToolHive HTTP operations

tools_filter.description: ToolsFilter is the list of tools to filter

transport.description: Transport is the transport mode (stdio, sse, or streamable-http)

volumes.description:
Volumes are the directory mounts to pass to the container
Format: "host-path:container-path[:ro]"

runtime.WorkloadStatus.description: Status is the current status of the workload.

enablePrometheusMetricsPath.description:
EnablePrometheusMetricsPath controls whether to expose Prometheus-style /metrics endpoint
The metrics are served on the main transport port at /metrics
This is separate from OTLP metrics which are sent to the Endpoint

endpoint.description: Endpoint is the OTLP endpoint URL

environmentVariables.description:
EnvironmentVariables is a list of environment variable names that should be
included in telemetry spans as attributes. Only variables in this list will
be read from the host machine and included in spans for observability.
Example: []string{"NODE_ENV", "DEPLOYMENT_ENV", "SERVICE_VERSION"}

headers.description: Headers contains authentication headers for the OTLP endpoint

insecure.description: Insecure indicates whether to use HTTP instead of HTTPS for the OTLP endpoint

samplingRate.description: SamplingRate is the trace sampling rate (0.0-1.0)

serviceName.description: ServiceName is the service name for telemetry

serviceVersion.description: ServiceVersion is the service version for telemetry

parameters.description:
Parameters is a JSON object containing the middleware parameters.
It is stored as a raw message to allow flexible parameter types.

type.description: Type is a string representing the middleware type.

types.ProxyMode.description: ProxyMode is the proxy mode for stdio transport ("sse" or "streamable-http")

types.TransportType.description: TransportType is the type of transport used for this workload.

v1.RegistryType.description: Type of registry (file, url, or default)

allow_private_ip.description: Allow private IP addresses for registry URL

groups.description: Groups is the list of groups configured on the client.

names.description: Names is the list of client names to operate on.

group.description: Group name to operate on (mutually exclusive with names)

names.description: Names of the workloads to operate on

groups.description: Groups is the list of groups configured on the client.

name.description: Name is the type of the client to register.

groups.description: Groups is the list of groups configured on the client.

name.description: Name is the type of the client that was registered.
Name of the group to create

v1.createRequest.description: Request to create a new workload

cmd_arguments.description: Command arguments to pass to the container

env_vars.description: Environment variables to set in the container

network_isolation.description: Whether network isolation is turned on. This applies the rules in the permission profile.

target_port.description: Port to expose from the container

v1.createSecretRequest.description: Request to create a new secret

v1.createWorkloadResponse.description: Response after successfully creating a workload

port.description: Port the workload is listening on

server_count.description: Number of servers in the registry

source.description: Source of the registry (URL, file path, or empty string for built-in)

type.description: Type of registry (file, url, or default)

v1.listSecretsResponse.description: Response containing a list of secret keys

v1.listServersResponse.description: Response containing a list of servers

servers.description: List of servers in the registry

can_cleanup.description: Whether the provider can cleanup all secrets

can_delete.description: Whether the provider can delete secrets

can_list.description: Whether the provider can list secrets

can_read.description: Whether the provider can read secrets

can_write.description: Whether the provider can write secrets

server_count.description: Number of servers in the registry

source.description: Source of the registry (URL, file path, or empty string for built-in)

v1.registryListResponse.description: Response containing a list of registries

v1.setupSecretsRequest.description: Request to setup a secrets provider

password.description:
Password for encrypted provider (optional, can be set via environment variable)
TODO Review environment variable for this

provider_type.description: Type of the secrets provider (encrypted, 1password, none)

v1.setupSecretsResponse.description: Response after initializing a secrets provider

provider_type.description: Type of the secrets provider that was setup

v1.updateSecretRequest.description: Request to update an existing secret

v1.workloadListResponse.description: Response containing a list of workloads

workloads.description: List of container information for each workload

info.description: This is the ToolHive API server.
info.title: ToolHive API

get.description: Returns the OpenAPI specification for the API
List all registered clients in ToolHive

post.description: Register a new client with ToolHive

get.description: List all clients compatible with ToolHive and their status
Get a list of all groups

post.description: Create a new group with the specified name

parameters.description: Delete all workloads in the group (default: false, moves workloads to default group)
parameters.name: with-workloads

get.description: Get details of a specific group
Get a list of the current registries
Get details of a specific registry

put.description: Update registry URL or local path for the default registry

get.description: Get a list of servers in a specific registry
Get details of a specific server in a registry
get.summary: Get a server from a registry

post.description: Setup the secrets provider with the specified type and configuration.

get.description: Get details of the default secrets provider
Get a list of all secret keys from the default provider

405.description: Method Not Allowed - Provider doesn't support listing

post.description: Create a new secret in the default provider (encrypted provider only)

405.description: Method Not Allowed - Provider doesn't support writing

delete.description: Delete a secret from the default provider (encrypted provider only)

404.description: Not Found - Provider not setup or secret not found

405.description: Method Not Allowed - Provider doesn't support deletion

put.description: Update an existing secret in the default provider (encrypted provider only)

404.description: Not Found - Provider not setup or secret not found

405.description: Method Not Allowed - Provider doesn't support writing

get.description: Returns the current version of the server
Get a list of all running workloads, optionally filtered by group

parameters.description: List all workloads, including stopped ones
parameters.name: all

post.description: Create and start a new workload
Delete multiple workloads by name or by group
Restart multiple workloads by name or by group
Stop multiple workloads by name or by group

get.description: Get details of a specific workload
Export a workload's run configuration as JSON
Retrieve at most 100 lines of logs for a specific workload by name.
get.summary: Get logs for a specific workload

get.description: Check if the API is healthy
